strats.name: X-Ray Climb Space Jump
note: X-ray climb until Samus is above the water surface.
To avoid falling out, be careful not to turn left except while holding X-ray.
From a standing position facing left, hold left and immediately jump, then use Space Jump to reach the ledge.
Alternatively, from a standing position facing right, do a turn-around spin jump, waiting to jump until part way through the turn-around animation (otherwise Samus will bonk inside the wall)

It is also possible to climb lower, with Samus' feet still in the water; in this case, the turn-around animation is slower, providing a larger window to jump, though in this case either a wall jump or a Space Jump water escape may be needed.

strats.name: Speedy Jump
strats.note: Jump from the raised alcove.  A down grab can help.

strats.name: Suitless Springball
note: 1) Start the jump from the raised alcove, standing on the edge facing right.
2) Turn-around spin jump to get the necessary horizontal speed to reach the upper ledge.
3) SpringBall jump after breaking the water line.
A lateral mid-air morph or spring fling can help, but are not required.
Unmorphing on a failed attempt can help avoid spike damage.

strats.name: Suitless Bootless
strats.note: This can be done by turning off Gravity and HiJump to do a mid-air morph through the morph tunnel.

strats.name: Cacatac Alley Springball Spike Boost
strats.note: When the Cacatac on the ground fires a spike, perform a  springball Jump to break the waterline and then hit the spike for extra height.

strats.name: Cacatac Alley HiJumpless Double SpringBall Jump and Bomb-Grapple-Jump
note: 1) Crouch jump and then SpringBall jump.
2) Bomb-Grapple-Jump using the distant Cacatac who is above the water.
3) SpringBall jump again just as Samus exits the water.

strats.name: Cacatac Alley Bomb Jump Water Escape
note: Perform the spring ball jump near max height.
Place the first bomb after the spring ball jump; just above the water line.
Press pause just after placing the bomb, to disable Spring Ball (a 'spring fling', to reset fall speed).
Place the second bomb soon after regaining control, while the game is fading back in.

strats.name: Cacatac Boost
note: Jump into the ceiling Cacatac and damage boost onto the platform between spike pits.
Use IFrames to cross the second set of spikes.

strats.name: Suitless HiJump
devNote: The first spike pit on the right is considered unavoidable, as if the player has Gravity and HiJump, the jump is quite tricky.
In that scenario, the player will hit the spikes or need the strat with canDisableEquipment.

strats.name: Suitless Bootless Jump
strats.note: This can be done by turning off Gravity and HiJump to jump over both spike pits.

strats.name: Suitless Springball
strats.note: This can be done by turning off Gravity and HiJump to jump over both spike pits.
devNote: This strat is only used if the player doesn't have canCarefulJump, because otherwise the Suitless Bootless strat will be used,
because canSpringBallJumpMidAir requires canDisableEquipment.

strats.name: Suitless Bootless
strats.note: This can be done by turning off Gravity and HiJump to jump over both spike pits.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph, Through the Hidden Tunnel
Pass Through Toilet
strats.note: Mid Air Morph before reaching the door transition, and without hitting a wall, in order to drift into the Morph tunnel quickly enough.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph, Through the Hidden Tunnel
Pass Through Toilet
strats.note: Mid Air Morph before reaching the door transition, and without hitting a wall, in order to drift into the Morph tunnel quickly enough.

to.devNote: This link refers specifically to crossing on frozen enemies.
This link refers specifically to crossing on frozen enemies.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Zoa
note: The Zoa needs to be at least 3 pixels higher than when it is frozen at standing height.
It may help to freeze one while standing to the left of it before it starts moving horizontally,
then move to a specific point on the slope to the right of it to position it vertically.
Freeze the Zoa a half-tile away from the runway in order to extend it as much as possible.

strats.name: Kill the Owtch
strats.note: The Owtch can be killed with a Power Bomb or blue speed, or while it is moving leftward with a Super, Charge, or Plasma.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zoa
note: Lure the Zoas. Jump so that they start moving horizontally higher, use spin jumps to move horizontally faster while keeping them on screen.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: The expectation is to fall down the left side of the sand entrance.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
strats.devNote: A 10 Power Bomb Crystal Flash strat may also be possible here, but it seems tricky to ensure that health-bomb won't interfere.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
strats.devNote: A 10 Power Bomb Crystal Flash strat may also be possible here, but it seems tricky to ensure that health-bomb won't interfere.

strats.name: East Sand Hole Suitless HiJump Perfect Bomb Boost
note: Reach the left side item using a single bomb explosion barely reach it.
Use HiJump to reach the water line and then use a Bomb Jump Water Escape motion to Bomb jump out of the water.
Do not Morph until fully out of the water to place the Bomb with the correct height.
And do not place the Bomb at the max possible height, but a little lower where it will bounce Samus higher.

strats.name: Suitless Bootless
strats.note: It's possible to get out of the sand suitless and without HiJump after falling from the chute, by hugging the left side and moving quickly.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Jump out of the sand before Shinesparking.

strats.name: Double Springball Jump
strats.note: Perform a double springball jump with the first jump being a bounce on the sand.

strats.name: East Sand Hole Underwater Walljumps
strats.note: Jump off the sand and use Underwater Walljumps to enter the maze leading to the Power Bomb location.

strats.name: East Sand Hole Insane Walljump Morph
strats.note: Walljump up and instant morph with exact timing and positioning so as to enter the Power Bomb location through the maze's exit.

strats.name: East Sand Hole Sandfall Bounce to Power Bombs
note: By using the sandfall physics, it is possible to springballjump to the Maridia Power Bomb location without Gravity or HiJump.
This requires a very precise spinjump into the sandfall which also exits the sandfall, after being pushed down, with more height than a regular jump.
It is very easy to fall into the sand and be unable to escape.

strats.name: Shinespark From the Sand
note: Shinespark vertically from the sand to get onto the first ledge.
Carefully jump onto the second ledge and return to lure the Boulder, or shoot it with a Super.

strats.name: Shinespark - Enter Spinning, Midair Diagonal Spark
strats.note: The shinespark must be performed near the upper ledge, and not inside the sandfall.

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark - Sand Jump Into Spark
note: Shinespark vertically from the sand to get onto the first ledge.
Carefully get to the second ledge and return to lure the Boulder, or shoot it with a Super.

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark - Enter Spinning, Midair Diagonal Spark
strats.note: The shinespark must be performed near the upper ledge, and not inside the sandfall.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Through Crumbles
strats.note: IBJ or Spring Ball Bomb Jump through two sets of Crumble Blocks.
devNote: Without this being Morph, there is no way to escape. PLMs are already overloaded from the sand.
FIXME Add a morphless double spring ball jump.

strats.name: Base
devNote: This does not require a mid-air morph, and Samus can roll from the ledge above to get into the morph tunnel.

nodes.name: Junction Between Items
nodes.note: Positioned in a tunnel above 5. You actually have to go back to 5 to move between the left and right portions of this junction, but access both ways has the same requirements.

nodes.name: Below Morph Tunnel Junction
nodes.note: Positioned below 5, next to the crumble blocks.

strats.name: Avoid Sand
strats.note: Land on the solid ground to the right and space jump or Springball over the sand.

strats.name: Gravity In Sand
strats.note: Gravity with a good jump from the sand can reach the Solid Rock Maze region.

strats.name: West Sand Hole Suitless Wall Jump Break Free
note: HiJump with a good jump from the sand can reach the Solid Rock Maze region.  Use the sandfall if Samus gets stuck in the sand.
Perform several wall jumps to climb up to the water level, then precise wall jumps to break free.

strats.name: West Sand Hole Space Wall Climb
strats.note: HiJump with a good jump from the sand can reach the Solid Rock Maze region. Use the sandfall if Samus gets stuck in the sand.

strats.name: Suitless Dual Jump Assist
note: HiJump with a good jump from the sand can reach the Solid Rock Maze region.  Use the sandfall if Samus gets stuck in the sand.
Bouncing on the sand as springball can reach the above maze by altering Samus' fall height, like by bouncing under the solid ledge before trying to jump up.
devNote: Jumping through the sandfall is failable enough to require canPlayInSand
This is not a traditional max height spring ball jump, as it requires HiJump and crosses the waterline, but it requires similar inputs and precision.

strats.name: Shinespark - Shoot the Block with Wave
note: Shoot the shot block before reaching the sand and then shinespark up.
A diagonal ShineSpark will most likely not have any horizontal movement when performed from the sand.
strats.devNote: Gravity has minimal effect on the required charge or spark frames.

strats.name: Shinespark - Shoot the Block with Wave, Enter with Spin, Diagonal Spark
strats.note: Shoot the shot block on the descent then shinespark diagonally up before hitting the sand.
strats.devNote: Gravity has minimal effect on the required charge or spark frames.

strats.name: Shinespark With Morph
note: Break the shot block before reaching the sand and then shinespark up.
Samus cannot shinespark after unmorphing until she touches the sand and this can be used to shoot upwards without sparking.
A diagonal ShineSpark will most likely not have any horizontal movement when performed from the sand.

strats.name: Shinespark With Hero Shot
note: Break the shot block before reaching the sand and then shinespark up.
A diagonal ShineSpark will most likely not have any horizontal movement when performed from the sand.

strats.name: G-Mode Through Crumbles from the Left
note: Get to the left side of the room while avoiding the hole in the ground, jump up through the Morph tunnel.
Jump up to the ledge with either Gravity, HiJump and a Crouch Jump Down Grab, or a maximum height Spring Ball Jump.

strats.name: Gravity
strats.note: Jump and morph directly into the morph tunnel.  Using a walljump can help make the jump safer.

strats.name: Gravity with Springball
strats.note: Springball bounce on top of the crumble blocks.  Use either a bomb or HiJump to gain a little bit of extra height.
strats.devNote: The tech requirement is `catching yourself on an aerial bomb` which is what canJumpIntoIBJ adds to canIBJ.  Only one bomb or powerbomb is needed.

strats.name: Suitless Mid Air Morph
strats.note: Escape the water with either HiJump or SpaceJump, then carefully jump and morph into the tunnel.

strats.name: West Sand Hole Bootless Suitless IBJ
strats.note: Jump off of the crumble blocks consecutively while placing a bomb on the water line and convert that into an IBJ to climb the West Sand Hole maze.

321.name: Toilet Bowl
321.note: This is the vertical pipe that connects Plasma Spark Room and Oasis. Visually it looks like a portion of Aqueduct and Botwoon Hallway (and surroundings).
devNote: There are no links because Samus can't move freely between the nodes.
Traversal through the room happens via each node's spawnAt property, placing Samus at the other end of the room with no option but to leave.
